Description: Do not stop or change current medications without consulting your primary physician.
In case of emergency (chest pain, difficulty breathing, etc.), call 911 or visit the nearest ER immediately.
This service provides general info only and does not replace professional medical diagnosis.
If symptoms persist or worsen after following the provided tips, seek clinical care immediately.
Do not rely solely on online information; always seek an in-person medical consultation.
To contribute to community health by delivering accurate and accessible health information.
BMI is a reference index calculated as [Weight(kg) / Height(m)²].
Reducing sodium intake and keeping a regular blood pressure log is critical.
Weight-bearing exercises (walking) and calcium intake are vital for bone health.
Effective oral care requires both proper brushing and consistent flossing.
Recommended 1.5–2L daily for adults, though this varies by individual health conditions.
Information on national support services and internal quit-smoking campaigns is available.
Follow the 20-20-20 rule: look 20 feet away for 20 seconds every 20 minutes.
Choose low-GI foods and take light walks after meals to manage blood sugar.
Sufficient sleep, balanced nutrition, and stress management are the primary pillars.
KF94 (or N95) masks are recommended when fine dust concentrations are high.
15–20 minutes of sun exposure daily helps with Vitamin D synthesis.
Combine iron-rich foods (spinach, red meat) with Vitamin C for better absorption.
Chew slowly and avoid lying down immediately after a meal.
Wash hands with soap for at least 30 seconds to prevent infectious diseases.
Maintain a regular wake-up time and avoid smartphones before bed.
Meditation, deep breathing, or hobbies are effective for stress reduction.
Stretch your neck and shoulders every hour if sitting for long periods.
Minimize exposure to known triggers like specific foods or pollen.
Take supplements during or after meals for higher absorption rates.
Annual influenza (flu) shots are recommended every autumn.
Consume vegetables, proteins, and carbs equally; reduce processed sugars.
30+ minutes of moderate intensity (brisk walking) 5 times a week is recommended.
Excessive drinking increases risks for liver and cardiovascular diseases.
Apply sunscreen 30 minutes before going outside to protect your skin.
Maintaining a weight appropriate for your height prevents adult-onset diseases.
A checkup every 1–2 years is the best prevention, even without symptoms.
Excessive caffeine can lead to insomnia or heart palpitations.
Bend your knees, not your waist, when lifting heavy objects.
Keep indoor humidity at 40–60% to protect respiratory mucous membranes.
